topic.title: Introduction
topic.shortdesc: This section serves to lead users through the key principles of Knowledge Base

body.p: This portal was developed based on the analysis on the content needs within the company. Company requirements on the portal organization principles are described in the PDF report Current Content State

p.note: To understand each menu bar sections' purpose, select the Finshape Knowledge Base at the top left corner, afterwards scroll down, and explore each section's and subsection's short description

Knowledge Base comprises of seven main Entities: Right, Role, Workspace, Use case (Task), Step, Data object, Data source. To make Knowledge Base content reusable, we should make changes within the Entity pages.

section.title: Knowledge Base purpose
section.p:
Priorities for Knowledge Base were defined:
DBOS Platform business overview
Business description of DBOS Components
Business description of DBOS Tools
Business and description of DBOS Applications
Guidance on how to accomplish use-cases (tasks)

dlentry.dd:
Platform business overview is the description of all platform capabilities from its user point of view (client's point of view). User's product description is being commonly presented in a form of the user guide. To see product's introduction and user guide, visit these sections:
Use-cases step-by-step guidance will be located in the section that has a name, example:

DBOS components business description is about describing component's capabilities from the user point of view (clients point of view). Components participating in standalone products are described in the related products docs. Components that are add-ons are described separately.
Use-cases related to components will be located in the section that has a name, example:

Tools are not the component of DBOS composite application. Therefore they are not described from the business point of view, but technically, in the section: . In case when Tool is being integrated in DBOS composite application, tool is becoming a DBOS component. And it's not important, if a Tool belongs to Finshape or a 3rd party. And in this case, it will be described from the business point of view (see above).
